section.title: Requirements
section.para: &At4J; requires Java 5 or a newer Java version to run.

section.title: Downloading &At4J;
section.para: &At4J; is distributed in two Zip archives. The binary archive contains everything necessary for using &At4J;. The source archive contains everything that the binary archive does, as well as unit test classes, test data and the complete &At4J; source code in an Eclipse workspace.

section.title: Installing &At4J;
section.para: Unzip the distribution into a directory.
The &At4J; Jar file and its dependencies are in the lib sub directory of the distribution.

section.title: Running unit tests (optional)
section.para: The source distribution comes with a Schmant script for running all unit tests.

To run the unit tests, open a command window (terminal, cmd) and change directory to the &At4J; source distribution's build directory. Set the JAVA_HOME environment variable to point to a Java JDK 6 installation. (Just a JRE won't do.)

On Unix, run: $ # For instance $ export JAVA_HOME=/opt/java6 $ schmant.sh -p javaCmd=[Java command] run_unit_tests.js
where the Java command is the path to the java to use for running the tests.

On Windows, run: > rem For instance. Note the absence of quotes in JAVA_HOME > set JAVA_HOME=c:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16 > schmant -p "javaCmd=[Java command]" run_unit_tests.js
where the Java command is the path to the java.exe to use for running the tests.
